intro: Leonia eneidensis, commonly known as the Eneidense Leonia, is a rare flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to red. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests. Due to habitat loss, Leonia eneidensis is considered endangered and is the subject of conservation efforts.
